```{python}
import polars as pl
import numpy as np
from lets_plot import *

LetsPlot.setup_html(isolated_frame=True)
```

```{python}
# Learn morea about Code Cells: https://quarto.org/docs/reference/cells/cells-jupyter.html

# Include and execute your code here
df = pl.read_csv("names_year_csv.csv")
```

## QUESTION 1

__What was the earliest year that the name ‘Felisha’ was used?__

_According to the output, the first name "Felisha" appears in the year 1964._

```{python}
# Q1
df.select(["name", "year", "Total"]).filter(pl.col("name") == "Felisha").sort("year").head()

```


## QUESTION 2

__What year had the most babies named 'David'? How many babies were named 'David' that year?__

_According to the output, the year 1955 had the most babies named "David," which is 86389._

```{python}
# Q2
df.select(["name", "year", "Total"]).filter(pl.col("name") == "David").sort("Total", descending=True).head()

```


## QUESTION 3

__What year did your name hit its peak? How many babies were named your name in that year?__

_According to the output, the year 1947 had the most babies named "John," which is 88474._

```{python}
# Q3
df.select(["name", "year", "Total"]).filter(pl.col("name") == "John").sort("Total", descending=True).head()

```


## QUESTION 4

__In the most recent year, what was the most common female name in Utah?__ 

_According to the output, in the year 2024 in Utah, the name "Olivia," which is a female name, has the highest number, which is 215._

```{python}
# Q4
# Get the column "name," "year," and "UT."
df.select(["name", "year", "UT"]).sort("year", "UT", descending=True).head(10)
```
